text: Scanning of the probe arrays using the Agilent GeneArray Scanner
Initial data analysis with the Microarray Suite software
(Parameters: Scanning hardware = G2500A GeneArray scanner [Agilent Technologies], Scanning software = MAS/GCOS/GREX [Affymetrix])

protocol.text: Plants were inoculated with powdery mildew spores and treated with control (0,05% TWEEN 20) solution at two days after inoculation. Plant material was collected 8 and 12 hours after treatment.

text: Plant material was ground to a fine powder in liquid nitrogen using pestle and mortar. Alternatively, 50-100 mg plant material was homogenised with an electrical homogeniser by totally adding 750 ul of Trizol extraction buffer (Invitrogen BV, Groningen, Netherlands). Subsequently, RNA was extracted according to the manufacturer's protocol (Chomczynski and Sacchi, 1987). The RNA was then further purified using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen, Basel, Switzerland) according to the protocols of the manufacturer.

protocol.text: Plants were inoculated with powdery mildew spores and treated with a 20 uM syringolin solution at two days after inoculation. Plant material was collected 2 and 4 hours after treatment.
Uninfected plants were treated with a 20 uM syringolin solution. Plant material was collected 1 hour after treatment.
Plants were inoculated with powdery mildew spores and treated with control solution (0,05% TWEEN 20) at two days after inoculation. Plant material was collected 2 and 4 hours after treatment.
Uninfected plants were treated with control solution (0,05% TWEEN 20). Plant material was collected 1 hour after treatment.

text: The probe was labelled with the Ambion MEGA Script T7 kit (Ambion, Huntingdon, UK) and finally purified again with the Affymetrix GeneChip Sample Cleanup module.
(Parameters: Amount of nucleic acid labeled = 15, Label used = biotin, Amplification = OTHER: amplification during IVT, Mass unit = Micro gram)

protocol.text: Plants were inoculated with powdery mildew spores and treated with a 20 uM syringolin solution at two days after inoculation. Plant material was collected 8 and 12 hours after treatment.
Uninfected plants were treated with control solution (0,05% TWEEN 20). Plant material was collected 8 and 12 hours after treatment.
equal amounts of plant material derived from two time point experiments were pooled in pairs
Uninfected plants were treated with a 20 uM syringolin solution. Plant material was collected 8 and 12 hours after treatment.

text: Arabidopsis thaliana accession Col-0 plants were grown in soil in growth chambers with a day/night cycle of 16 h/8 h, a light intensity of 100-150 uE, and a constant temperature of 20-22degreeC. 12-14 day-old plants were used for experiments
(Parameters: start time = 12, stop time = 14, time unit = days, min temperature = 20, max temperature = 22, temperature unit = C)
